intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium parvipilosella, commonly known as the small-hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and disturbed soils. It has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Hieracium parvipilosella is often found in temperate regions of Europe and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
